Comment: Another alternating verb is tȟókča ‘to be different’/itȟókča ‘to be different from’ (e.g. a different man/a man different from his father).

Translation: The man who is rich went home.
The man is/was rich in property (real estate).
The man is/was rich in it (e.g. property/ real estate).
Intended: The man rich in property went home.
Intended: The man rich in it (e.g. property/ real estate) went home.
The man who is rich in it (in property) went home.
Comment: The comma indicates the demarcation of the subordinated clause and corresponds to a prosodic pause.
